Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

Thanks! http://codereview.appspot.com/5777054/diff/3001/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5777054/diff/3001/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode7 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:7: Cgo lets Go packages call C code. Given a Go source file written with some Please don't indent. http://codereview.appspot.com/5777054/diff/3001/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode131 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:131: You can use the go tool to build a cgo package: To build cgo packages, just use "go build" or "go install" as usual. The go tool recognizes the special "C" import and automatically uses cgo for those files. (and link to the relevant /cmd/go/ sections for go build and go install) http://codereview.appspot.com/5777054/diff/3001/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode157 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:157: href="http://code.google.com/p/go/source/browse/src/pkg/runtime/cgocall.c">cgocall.c. href="/src/pkg/runtime/cgocall.c"
